New Records: Victor Wembanyama became the first player in NBA history to reach 2,273 points, 1,053 rebounds, 386 assists, 366 blocks, and 225 3s in his first 100 games
LeBron James passed Michael Jordan for the most 30-point games all-time (563)
Key Match Events: Thunder outscored the Knicks 37-19 in the 4th quarter to edge out in a heavyweight bout
Aaron Wiggins dropped 15 of his 19 points in the 4th quarter on 5-of-5 shooting with four 3s
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander responded with a clutch floater and two game-sealing free throws after Josh Hart's putback
Victor Wembanyama delivered a decisive blow, stealing Nikola Jokić's pass with four seconds left to seal a thrilling Spurs win
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks will face another high-octane offense tonight in Chicago, which ranks seventh in points (117.2) and tied for second in made 3s (16.4)
Chicago averages 38.8 ppg in catch-and-shoot situations on 35.3 attempts, both the highest marks in the NBA
Post-Match Reflections: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander expressed pride in his team's effort after the win
Karl-Anthony Towns recorded a massive double-double (17 pts, 22 reb) for the Knicks
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder drew even with the 1995-96 SuperSonics for the longest win streak in franchise history
CJ McCollum tied his career-high with 50 points in just 30 minutes and 41 seconds
The Cavaliers are just the fourth team since 2000-01 to open a season at 30-4 or better
Victor Wembanyama's performance punctuated a historic milestone for Wembanyama — unmatched by any player before him
